questions.question: Which condition will result in zero reflection in a transmission line?

explanations.a: Incorrect – a short circuit reflects all energy.
explanations.b: Incorrect – an open circuit also reflects all energy.
explanations.c: Correct – perfect matching results in Γ = 0.

questions.question: What happens to input impedance when the load is mismatched and the line is a quarter wavelength long?

explanations.a: Incorrect – matching occurs only if Z_L = Z_0.
explanations.c: Correct – a quarter-wave transformer inverts Z_L/Z_0.
explanations.d: Incorrect – zero impedance only under specific shorts.

questions.question: Which method can be used to reduce reflection on a transmission line?

explanations.a: Incorrect – frequency does not eliminate reflection.
explanations.b: Incorrect – line length does not correct mismatch.
explanations.d: Incorrect – adding capacitance could worsen mismatch.

questions.question: What role does the velocity factor play in a transmission line?

answers.b: It affects the propagation speed of signals

explanations.a: Incorrect – power loss is not directly related.
explanations.c: Incorrect – Z_0 depends on geometry and materials.
explanations.d: Incorrect – return loss depends on Γ.
